final_answer:
The humor or satire in the image comes from the juxtaposition of the two scenes, highlighting a common relatable experience. 

On the left, a woman is shown contentedly enjoying the soft texture of a sweater, representing the positive expectation of wearing something cozy and comfortable. 

On the right, another woman is depicted as uncomfortable, with a red neck caused by a scratchy manufacturer's tag, a common annoyance for many people. 

The "YES, BUT" text format humorously sets up the expectation of comfort but quickly undercuts it with the reality of the annoying tag. This exaggerates the frustration of clothing tags and adds a layer of humor to everyday inconveniences.
